hero.description: Analyze and explore computer science curricula from the world's leading universities through a unified, high-performance interface.

mission.label: System Architecture
mission.desc_1: CodeCampus is a specialized search engine that indexes public course catalogs from the world's top universities, creating a unified schema for comparison.
mission.desc_2: We don't host content. Instead, we structure scattered data—prerequisites, difficulty ratings, and syllabi—into a single, queryable knowledge graph to help you build your own learning roadmap.

universal_index.title: Universal Index
universal_index.desc: Query a normalized database of curricula from MIT, Stanford, Berkeley, and CMU in one unified interface.

progress_analytics.title: Progress Analytics
progress_analytics.desc: Log your completed coursework. Visualize your academic velocity and track credit distribution across domains.

gap_analysis.title: Gap Analysis
gap_analysis.desc: Compare your transcript against top degree requirements to identify missing prerequisites and skill voids.
